question: 別冊
sourceMnemonic: Usually you call <kanji>books</kanji> "volumes" when they come in sets, right? This is like that, but <kanji>separate</kanji>, making this a <vocabulary>separate volume</vocabulary>.
sourceReadingMnemonic: This is a jukugo word, which usually means on'yomi readings from the kanji. If you know the readings of your kanji you'll know how to read this as well. The <ja>べつ</ja> gets shortened to <ja>べっ</ja>, though, probably because it's a <ja>つ</ja> and that's what <ja>つ</ja>s do for a living in jukugo words.
